channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Qatar is said to be giving Trump a new plane
item.description: The offer, which comes on the eve of Trump's visit to the Middle East, raises major ethical and legal questions.
item.content:encoded:
The offer, which comes on the eve of Trump's visit to the Middle East, raises major ethical and legal questions.

(Image credit: BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: U.S. halts cattle imports from Mexico, citing fears of flesh-eating maggot
item.description: The New World screwworm is endemic in parts of Latin America and the Caribbean — and its northward spread into Mexico has alarmed U.S. officials. It can kill a full-grown cow in one to two weeks.
item.content:encoded:
The New World screwworm is endemic in parts of Latin America and the Caribbean — and its northward spread into Mexico has alarmed U.S. officials. It can kill a full-grown cow in one to two weeks. 

(Image credit: USDA)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: U.S. and China cite progress in trade talks but release few details
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said details will be released Monday after a weekend of talks in Switzerland.
item.content:encoded:
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said details will be released Monday after a weekend of talks in Switzerland.

(Image credit: Martial Trezzini)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Hamas says it will release Israeli American Edan Alexander, held hostage in Gaza
item.description: Edan Alexander, a dual U.S.-Israeli citizen, is the last remaining American citizen held by Hamas in Gaza who is believed to still be alive. President Trump confirmed the plans for his release.
item.content:encoded:
Edan Alexander, a dual U.S.-Israeli citizen, is the last remaining American citizen held by Hamas in Gaza who is believed to still be alive. President Trump confirmed the plans for his release.

(Image credit: Amir Levy)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Here's what U.S. Catholics are saying about the election of Pope Leo XIV
item.description: At services on Sunday, some Catholics took particular pride in the election of the first American pontiff, who has familial ties to multiple places across the country.
item.content:encoded:
At services on Sunday, some Catholics took particular pride in the election of the first American pontiff, who has familial ties to multiple places across the country.

(Image credit: Nam Y. Huh)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: The U.S. has a plan for getting food into Gaza. Top aid groups object to the idea
item.description: The proposed solution would only provide food and aid to around 60 percent of Gaza's civilians initially, according to a copy of the proposal reviewed by NPR.
item.content:encoded:
The proposed solution would only provide food and aid to around 60 percent of Gaza's civilians initially, according to a copy of the proposal reviewed by NPR.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Pope Leo XIV calls for peace in Gaza and Ukraine, saying 'Never again war'
item.description: Pope Leo XIV called for a ceasefire in Gaza and an end to the war in Ukraine on Sunday, in his first Sunday noon blessing as pontiff since his election.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Leo XIV called for a ceasefire in Gaza and an end to the war in Ukraine on Sunday, in his first Sunday noon blessing as pontiff since his election.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Luxury dog hotels give some people pause amid the inequality of South Africa
item.description: High-end accommodations for pooches are thriving in one of the world's most unequal countries. They have their defenders and their critics. Who's barking up the right tree?
item.content:encoded:
High-end accommodations for pooches are thriving in one of the world's most unequal countries. They have their defenders and their critics. Who's barking up the right tree?

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Tommy Trenchard

item.title: I wanted to know why my mom was so hard on us kids growing up. So I finally asked
item.description: When she was a kid growing up in Kenya, Esther Ngumbi was mad at her mom for being so tough on her. Now she's grateful -- but she wanted to know, did her mother realize how her kids felt at the time?
item.content:encoded:
When she was a kid growing up in Kenya, Esther Ngumbi was mad at her mom for being so tough on her. Now she's grateful -- but she wanted to know, did her mother realize how her kids felt at the time?

(Image credit: Family photo)
item.dc:creator: Esther Ndumi Ngumbi

item.title: India and Pakistan ceasefire shaken by overnight fighting in disputed Kashmir region
item.description: People on both sides of the Line of Control, which divides the territory, reported heavy exchanges of fire between Indian and Pakistani troops. The fighting subsided by Sunday morning.
item.content:encoded:
People on both sides of the Line of Control, which divides the territory, reported heavy exchanges of fire between Indian and Pakistani troops. The fighting subsided by Sunday morning.

(Image credit: Roshan Mughal)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
